image.altText: Two men stand next to each other. They are wearing suits.

props.synopsis: A coronial inquest has heard the system failed First Nations prisoner Clinton Austin before his death.

title.children: Inquest hears prison system failed inmate found unresponsive in cell

image.altText: High security fence with tree in foreground

props.synopsis: A former youth detainee is jailed over a violent assault that took place when a group of inmates stole a set of keys and sent the Malmsbury Youth Justice Centre into lockdown in October 2023.

title.children: Man sentenced over 'truly shocking' youth detention centre assault

image.altText: A grey wallaby visible from only the chest upwards surrounded by ferns.

props.synopsis: A study prompted by the deaths of wallabies at a beloved wildlife reserve south of Melbourne finds the population has grown five times larger than what The Briars sanctuary can sustain.

title.children: Council calls urgent meeting as wallabies starve to death at sanctuary

image.altText: A woman is seen from behind and through some fabric hanigng out clothing on a washing line.

props.synopsis: As a family violence survivor and mother-of-two, Maya was assessed as a high priority for social housing. Eight years later, she's finally moved into a suitable home in outer-suburban Melbourne, with vulnerable Victorians left waiting for years as the social housing waitlist soars.

title.children: Maya fled family violence, only to spend eight years in housing limbo

image.altText: A man looks ahead with a serious expression. Behind him is a wall of a brick house.

props.synopsis: The controversial church offered to settle with Mick Dover over his allegations of abuse, but only if he signed a non-disclosure agreement and agreed not to disparage them in any way.

title.children: 'Not worth it. I'd rather tell you': Mick Dover turned down $1m to do this interview

image.altText: Four fully enclosed biohazard suits, two white, one orange and one yellow, hanging up.

props.synopsis: Step into one of Australia's few biosafety level 4 facilities, where scientists handle highly transmissible and potentially lethal pathogens such as Ebola and Hendra virus.

title.children: Behind these airlocked doors, Australian scientists study deadly diseases

image.altText: A photo of a rectangular building wiith red bricks and many broken windows, on a grass surface with nearby bushes

props.synopsis: A retired nurse who worked at Moe Hospital says the closed facility could be used for housing rather than left to further rot.

title.children: Trashed former hospital site hits market after years of decay

image.altText: Floodwater runs off road, side of road has slipped. People stand nearby to look at damage.

props.synopsis: Victorian councils say they are required to provide before-and-after photos of every 100 metres of road in order to be eligible for flood recovery funding.

title.children: Road repairs after flood delayed by 'excruciating' eligibility criteria

image.altText: A camouflage officer looks at the entrance of a cave near Porepunkah

props.synopsis: New Zealand police briefly joined the search for alleged police killer Dezi Freeman as travel advice for Victoria's north-east eases.

title.children: Dezi Freeman search now Australia's largest tactical police deployment

image.altText: Scott Pendlebury runs with the ball while wearing the Big V of Victoria

props.synopsis: AFL chief executive Andrew Dillon confirms Western Australia will play Victoria in Perth next February in the first State of Origin match since 1999.

title.children: AFL announces State of Origin return with WA-Vic clash confirmed

image.altText: close up of platypus head

props.synopsis: Anglers are urged to dispose of illegal fishing nets and stick with safer open-top traps, after two platypuses are found drowned in regional Victorian waterways.

title.children: Two platypuses found dead in illegal fishing traps in one week

image.altText: A sign with a photo of Premier Jacinta Allan with the word banned in a window.

props.synopsis: Rural residents and local councils are deeply unhappy with new taxes, renewable energy, bad roads and mining companies, accusing the state government of "city centric" policymaking.

title.children: 'White-hot anger' in the bush as Victorians take on Allan government

image.altText: A man in a field of cows, petting the head of a cow laying down.

props.synopsis: As spring brings a flicker of hope, some farmers cautiously embrace optimism while others face mounting pressures and climate uncertainty.

title.children: Hope springs eternal for one farmer as others stand on the brink

image.altText: Gayle Osborne stands next to a tall tree in a forest and holds binoculars.

props.synopsis: Conservation groups are celebrating proposed legislation for three new national parks in Victoria but not all bush users are happy.

title.children: Victoria set to have first new national parks in more than a decade

image.altText: G8 graphic

props.synopsis: Despite G8 knowing about problems, an ABC investigation can reveal how the childcare giant downplayed concerns and maintained it had conducted checks.

title.children: A $26m unorthodox childcare deal with devastating fallout

image.altText: A teenage girl wearing a green hoodie sits on a tree stump in a forest breaking a stick.

props.synopsis: One in four children starting school now has a speech or language delay. It can hold back their learning, affect their friendships and harm their mental health. Speech therapists are struggling to find ways to support them all, but one school is leading the way.

title.children: When speaking doesn't come easily, the consequences can be life altering

image.altText: Woman with dark hair and fringe wears jeans and purple sweater sitting with feet crossed in a bay window. Cushions beside her

props.synopsis: Kate Reid's Lune croissants have been called the world's best. But how did a young woman struggling with a near-fatal eating disorder end up perfecting pastry?

title.children: How the quest to make the perfect croissant saved Kate’s life

image.altText: Kangaroos players celebrate a high-five after a goal

props.synopsis: North Melbourne continues its blistering start to the AFLW season as Geelong and St Kilda also record big wins in Round 5.

title.children: Reigning AFLW premiers North flex muscles in grand final rematch

image.altText: A young Dau bounces a baskteball on an outside court

props.synopsis: Last weekend, Dau Akueng, 15, and Chol Achiek, 12, were fatally stabbed on their way home from basketball in Melbourne's western suburbs. The pair is being remembered by those who knew them for who they were, not just how they tragically died.

title.children: At 15, Dau wanted to be the best. He was ambitious, but playful too

image.altText: Carlton players celebrate during a match against Gold Coast.

props.synopsis: Inaugural Carlton player Gab Pound says the club has reached a turning point after not making the finals since the 2020 COVID-interrupted season.

title.children: Inaugural Blue hopes for finals berth after hot start

image.altText: Royal Children's Hospital Melbourne

props.synopsis: Melbourne's Royal Children's Hospital says a symposium on the effect of war on children has been cancelled due to safety fears, but some doctors say pressure from a group opposing antisemitism is to blame.

title.children: Hospital's children in war event cancelled amid safety fears

image.altText: A Muslim woman with brown skin stands dressed in a headscarf infront of a shelf holding her hands

props.synopsis: When Nausheen Hashmi moved to a south-west Victorian farming town, she wondered how the locals would greet her and her children. She need not have worried.

title.children: Meet the migrants who make this small country town flourish

image.altText: A rally in Sydney

props.synopsis: Rallies against racism and in support of Indigenous sovereignty coincide with mixed anti-government protests in major cities around the country.

title.children: Capital cities witness day of protest across political spectrum

image.altText: An elderly lady on sitting on a walker, having a cup of tea on a verandah

props.synopsis: Elderly residents of Porepunkah have had their home nurse visits cancelled as alleged police killer Dezi Freeman remains at large.

title.children: Dezi Freeman manhunt leaves elderly people without in-home care

image.altText: Ty Gallop flexes his arms as he celebrates an AFL goal for the Lions against the Suns.

props.synopsis: Bouncing back from a resounding loss to Geelong, the Brisbane Lions comfortably dispense of the Gold Coast Suns to advance to the preliminary finals.

title.children: Lions credit Cats for setting up Suns' semifinal demolition

image.altText: A group of Collingwood AFLW players walk back smiling after a goal.

props.synopsis: Collingwood, wooden spooners last season, keep Sydney goalless for more than three quarters at home on Saturday for an upset win, as Port Adelaide beat another unbeaten side in Melbourne.

title.children: Swans' perfect start ends as Magpies stun at home

image.altText: Brad Battin speaks to media at Parliament House in Melbourne. He stands in front of a dark background.

props.synopsis: More than a year out from the next state election, Opposition Leader Brad Battin is making a pitch to Victorians to make them safer. His policy centrepiece is 'Jack's Law', to give police greater powers to randomly search people for weapons.

title.children: Victorian opposition plan to increase powers to search people for weapons

image.altText: A man wearing a dark shirt stands outside a courthouse

props.synopsis: Neo-Nazi leader Thomas Sewell has been ordered to serve 200 hours of community service after being found guilty of intimidating a police officer.

title.children: Neo-Nazi Thomas Sewell found guilty of intimidating police officer

image.altText: A beautifully refurbished church which is now a school's performing arts centre

props.synopsis: St Michael's Grammar School in St Kilda has apologised after a cast list for an upcoming musical was uploaded to an internal website with physical descriptions such as "bogan" and "tall goof" next to students' names.

title.children: Melbourne school apologises for 'unacceptable' student descriptions

image.altText: Two men in suits outside court.

props.synopsis: James Fitzgerald and Alexander Papanastassis are charged with negligent manslaughter over the death of Luke Briggs, who died eight days after his arrest last year.

title.children: Police officers face court over death of Luke Briggs

image.altText: A police car with its lights on.

props.synopsis: Police allege two men fatally shot a man in Melbourne two days after shooting another dead.

title.children: Two men charged with murder allegedly involved in second fatal shooting

image.altText: Dezi Freeman pictured outside a court in Wangaratta.

props.synopsis: A criminology researcher says rewards do work as a way of catching people, even if the success rate appears low.

title.children: Former police say rewards can work as $1m offered in Dezi Freeman search

image.altText: Fans cheer at Albert Park for the 2022 F1 Australian Grand Prix

props.synopsis: The Victorian government fails to win enough crossbench support for its bill to extend the Australian Formula One Grand Prix from a seven-day event to 21 days.

title.children: Plan to extend Melbourne F1 GP to three weeks shelved

image.altText: Wide shot of three turbine floating on top of the water with two boats

props.synopsis: A Victorian wind farm project that promises to power more than a million homes has been put on ice as developers worry the proposal will not meet government timelines.

title.children: Developers press pause on $8b offshore wind project
